turns.content: What are some common visual effects used in game trailers to showcase impressive graphics or game mechanics?

1. Cinematic camera angles: Game trailers often use cinematic camera angles to showcase the stunning graphics of the game.

2. Slow-motion effects: Slow-motion effects can emphasise the impact of powerful attacks or showcase the fluidity of motion-captured animations.

3. Environment and lighting effects: Game trailers use environment and lighting effects to show the realistic and immersive world of the game.

4. Particle effects: Effects such as explosions or sparks can add a sense of dynamism and excitement to the game trailer.

5. Post-processing effects: Game trailers often use post-processing effects such as color correction, lens flares, and depth of field effects to improve the visual quality and create a cinematic feel.

6. 3D animation: 3D animation is often used to show off the dynamic movements of characters and objects in the game.

7. Motion graphics: Motion graphics can be used to illustrate game mechanics, user interfaces, and HUD elements.

8. Advanced physics: Game trailers can show off advanced physics simulations, such as destructible environments and realistic physics-based movement. 

9. Real-time rendering: Game trailers can showcase the impressive performance of the game engine through real-time rendering of complex scenes and animations.

10. Dynamic weather effects: Game trailers can use dynamic weather effects to showcase the various weather conditions and how they can affect gameplay.
